{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3578022,"name":"","username":"BUG","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/fbc32d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-02T17:02:28.725Z","cooked":"

I’m trying to model a continuous elevator using a belt for rigging, with the belt running outside the elevator profiles. However, I’m having trouble figuring out how to design the rigging. Does anyone have a CAD file to share as an example (besides 3847)?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-04-02T17:02:28.725Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":50,"reads":286,"readers_count":285,"score":307.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":497838,"topic_slug":"continuoues-elevator-rigging","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65948,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/continuoues-elevator-rigging/497838/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3578063,"name":"Eliot Dunn","username":"Eliot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eliot/{size}/207280_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-02T17:46:35.852Z","cooked":"

Here is a continuously rigged belt elevator example I made:

Belted Continous In-tube no tube manufacturing elevator Technical Discussion
[Thin_2_Stage_Example_8] Well, that was a long title. Two months ago I had an idea (and a challenge) to make a COTS-compatible belt in-tube elevator. [{71BCC078-BD41-4D3C-9826-332B1D31D097}] The main constraint was that teams had to be able to manufacture a continuous elevator with no tube CNC and just a band saw and a vendor kit. My first iteration revolved around giant billet bearing blocks, which wasn’t workable. (Thank you to @thevedantin for trying to make it workable) [Bearing Blo…

Note, the bearing block construction is unique. 9496 uses almost this exact elevator this season.

I know that Team SCREAM [4522] and STAGS [1262] have continuous rigging.

One of their elevator files: Onshape

Also here is there actual build log

Team SCREAM 4522 and Team SCREAM Jr 4766 | Build Blog 2025 FRC Open Alliance
Competition Bot Update We apologize for being quiet lately—we’ve been fully immersed in a complete overhaul and redesign of our robot. A lot of factors led to this redesign, but our main focus was increasing scoring speed and maintaining a symmetrical robot for better CG management during the climb. Key reasons for the change: Our algae floor intake/climber combo showed promise, but we struggled to center the chain consistently, and the setup time for climbing was too slo…

Here is the 1262 CAD

cad.onshape.com

Onshape

Sign in to Onshape, the #1 fastest growing CAD system in the world with over 4 million users.

Earlier in the process

2ea994b8abb0198de40caefd60a24b4e3025407a_2_750x750750×750 53.6 KB
